description: Students investigate contemporary approaches to classical issues in metaphysics, which include
the mind-body problem; personal identity and immortality; space and time; causality; and realism,
anti-realism, and truth. Specific issues discussed vary from year to year.  May be repeated if
topics are different.  Prerequisites: two courses in philosophy, one of which must be either 235
or 236, or permission of the department chair.  Offered 2009-10 and alternate years.
